title: Add support for dynamic tab names
author: rubaboo
body_snippet:
<!-- Feature Request -->
<!-- If you file a feature request, please delete the bug section -->
As detailed in [MR-571](https://mremoteng.atlassian.net/browse/MR-571):

> It would be great to have support for dynamic tab names, similar to the application SuperPutty. Escape codes in a terminal window set the tab name. This is useful in Cygwin terminals to change the tab name to the target of an ssh command, etc.
> 
> For example this function in bash sets the tab title:
> 
> title ()
> {...

iterations.description: The request is a clear, user-facing enhancement and the existing tab infrastructure can be extended to update tab text from terminal title changes with low regression risk.

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet: No worries about the Atlassian account - what you did here is perfect

notes:
AI triage (codex): The request is a clear, user-facing enhancement and the existing tab infrastructure can be extended to update tab text from terminal title changes with low regression risk.
Approach: Listen for embedded terminal title changes (PuTTY/terminal), apply them to `ConnectionTab.TabText` with fallback to current naming rules, and add protocol tests for update and teardown behavior.
